requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

state.requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

functional_requirements.description: Users can add new tasks to their to-do list.
acceptance_criteria: An input field is available for entering task descriptions.
A button or the 'Enter' key submits the new task.
The new task appears in the task list upon submission.

functional_requirements.description: Users can view a list of all their tasks.
acceptance_criteria: All added tasks are displayed in a list format.
Each task item clearly shows its description.

functional_requirements.description: Users can mark tasks as complete or incomplete.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has a checkbox or a similar interactive element to mark it as complete.
Clicking the element toggles the task's completion status.
Completed tasks are visually differentiated from pending tasks (e.g., with a strikethrough).

functional_requirements.description: Users can edit the description of existing tasks.
acceptance_criteria: An 'Edit' option is available for each task.
Users can modify the text of a task and save the changes.

functional_requirements.description: Users can delete tasks from their list.
acceptance_criteria: A 'Delete' option is available for each task.
Clicking the 'Delete' option removes the task from the list.

functional_requirements.description: Tasks are saved persistently using the browser's local storage.
acceptance_criteria: Tasks persist in the browser after a page refresh or closing and reopening the tab.

functional_requirements.description: The application is responsive and works on both mobile and desktop devices.
acceptance_criteria: The application layout adjusts gracefully to different screen sizes, from mobile phones to desktops.
All functionality is accessible and usable on all supported screen sizes.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application should load quickly and provide smooth user interactions.
metrics: Initial page load time under 2 seconds.
UI updates (add, edit, delete) should be reflected in under 200ms.

non_functional_requirements.description: The interface must be intuitive and easy for a first-time user to understand.
metrics: A new user can successfully add, complete, and delete a task within one minute without instructions.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application must function correctly on the latest versions of major web browsers.
metrics: Full functionality is verified on the latest stable versions of Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and Apple Safari.

risks: Data Loss: Since data is stored in local storage, users can inadvertently clear it through browser settings, leading to permanent data loss.
Scope Creep: Requests for features like user accounts, cloud sync, or task categories could significantly increase complexity and development time.
Browser Inconsistencies: Minor visual or functional differences may occur across different web browsers, requiring specific CSS/JS fixes.
assumptions: A backend with user authentication is not required for the initial version.
The application will rely solely on browser local storage for data persistence.
The design will be simple and functional, prioritizing usability over complex aesthetics.

state.message: Requirements analysis complete. Awaiting human review.
